report_title: ATV Rentals & Tour Services in the US
executive_summary: Companies in this Companies in the ATV Rentals and Tour Services industry rent all-terrain vehicles (ATV) and equipment for recreational use. Many companies also offer guided tours on ATVs. Through the end of 2024, rising disposable income and growth in downstream markets have spurred demand for social events and discretionary activities. However, the COVID-19 pandemic significantly hindered demand as large gatherings were prohibited to prevent the virus spread. Nonessential businesses were forced to close down and consumers allocated their funds toward the necessities. Nonetheless, pent-up consumer demand following the containment of the pandemic enabled the industry to rapidly recover, effectively offsetting prior losses.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Disposable Income, Consumer Sentiment and Leisure Time All Influence Demand Conditions
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Companies in the ATV Rentals and Tour Services industry rent all-terrain vehicles (ATV) and equipment for recreational use. Many companies also offer guided tours on ATVs. Since these products are discretionary, product demand depends on disposable income. Higher disposable income typically translates to an increase in industry demand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: ATV Rentals and Tour Services industry revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: ATV Rentals and Tour Services industry revenue has been inching upward at a CAGR of 0.1% over the past five years and is expected to total $697.7 million in 2024, when revenue will jump by an estimated 2.0%. Amid the economic recovery following the pandemic in 2021, the industry became more competitive as low barriers to entry and a relatively high profit margin induced many new companies to enter the marketplace.

Along the same lines, consumer sentiment influences industry revenue. When consumers are optimistic about future economic conditions, they are more willing to make a purchase. Also, when consumers have more leisure time, they are more likely to rent ATVs for recreational purposes. The industry has benefited from improving economic conditions over the five years to 2024.

The COVID-19 pandemic significantly hampered performance, leading to the industry's largest ever single-year decline. This was due to government-mandated stay-at-home orders and nonessential business restrictions, which effectively stunted demand from downstream markets. As the pandemic slowed down, many state governments eased business restrictions, permitting ATV rental and tour service companies to resume normal operating conditions.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Profit Declined Amid the Pandemic and Continues to be Lower Than Pre-Pandemic Levels
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Since most industry revenue is derived from discretionary activities, industry rental companies contend with macroeconomic conditions, most notably per capita disposable income and consumer sentiment levels. After the COVID-19 pandemic began, demand for ATV rentals and tour services declined as the economy entered a downturn, resulting in many individuals losing their jobs. Due to poor macroeconomic conditions, industry profit sharply decreased in 2020 and has yet to reach pre-pandemic levels, despite recovering demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Strong and Steady Growth is on the Horizon
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Moving forward, revenue for the ATV Rentals and Tour Services industry will strongly recover. Many of the same factors that benefited the industry over the five years to 2024 will continue to persist over the outlook period. Consumers are set to become more financially stable following the negative economic effects of the COVID-19 pandemic, increasing the shares of revenue and income available for discretionary goods and services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising Travel Patterns Will Boost Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Due to the containment of the COVID-19 pandemic as a result of mass immunization efforts and herd immunity, travel patterns will resume to pre-pandemic levels. Increased travel by consumers will lead to more ATV tour purchases and higher rental volumes, boosting industry revenue. Also, as households continue to recover following COVID-19, they will have more interest in partaking in social gathering activities, which can include industry activities.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Increased Leisure Time and Higher Disposable Income Will Benefit the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: A core development moving forward is the pent-up demand from consumers in partaking in leisure-related activities. Despite heightened inflationary pressures, steady growth in disposable income and a strong desire to attend social events will accelerate the need for ATV rental and tour services. Nonetheless, consumers may be more selective in their options, particularly as expansion of online services will create more affordable alternate options and this could potentially dampen further revenue growth.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry rent all-terrain vehicles (ATV) and equipment for recreational use. Many operators also offer guided tours on ATVs.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers: Consumer confidence index

key_trends: Rebound in disposable income enhances appeal of ATV rentals and tour services. The consistent growth of per capita disposable income enables households to spend more on discretionary purchases, including ATV rentals and associated services.

Pent-up demand during COVID-19 influences high ATV rental rates. Consumers' propensity to attend social gatherings and go on vacations skyrocketed following the pandemic, which created a boom for the rental of all types of ATVs.
ATV rental and tour service companies encounter regulations on vehicle fuel consumption and emissions. This has driven investment in fuel-saving and alternative fuel engine technologies.
ATV rental and tour service companies receive some support in the form of industry associations. This includes the Motorcycle Industry Council (MIC).
Two-seater ATV rentals remain the industry's largest product. Six-seater ATVs also account for a significant portion of demand, with two-seaters following close behind.
Demand for recreational activities including pleasure and trail riding booms as COVID restrictions dissipate. Increased travel patterns continue to aid the industry.

ATV rental and tour service companies need to obtain the necessary licenses and permits to operate legally. Also, before competing with established competitors, new entrants must purchase, maintain and secure a sizable fleet of vehicles with rental and leasing sites.

There are various ATV rental and tour service companies, including both national chains and local businesses. The availability of numerous options gives buyers the flexibility to shop around and select the company that best meets their needs and budget.

Operating within a local or regional area enables ATV rental and tour service companies to focus on efficient logistics. They can establish a network of rental locations, service centers and maintenance facilities in a concentrated area.

Individuals that frequently require ATV transportation may choose to purchase or lease their own vehicles. This is a more cost-effective option for long-term or frequent use, but it comes with the responsibilities of vehicle maintenance, insurance and operating costs.
Profit has decreased over the past five years. Some larger companies have increasingly been renting out higher-end products in an attempt to mitigate profit declines, which has proved successful.

Wages are a prominent cost for ATV rental and tour service companies. Skilled employees are needed to educate the buyer on how to use the product, along with maintaining the vehicles and conducting tours.

Six-seaters offer plenty of cargo and extra seating space to accommodate large groups.
Two-seater ATVs are smaller and can be easily transported via truck, turn quicker and are often less expensive than their four- or six-seater counterparts.
ATV tours are a popular family activity and demand closely follows overall travel patterns.

FAQs.question: How reliant is your business on the strength and stability of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: The industry is moderately reliant on the strength and stability of the US economy. Demand for industry services is largely procyclical, with expansionary periods stimulating demand from both downstream businesses and households. The industry experiences moderate revenue volatility as it provides discretionary products and services that follow the business cycle.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition possibilities in locations with well-established, dynamic commercial markets?
FAQs.answer: Acquisition activity among the industry's largest players has increased during the current period, leading to a rise in overall industry market share concentration. Industry consolidation has increased as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, as smaller operators were forced to exit due to lower demand.

FAQs.question: Have you successfully cut wage costs through automation in recent years?
FAQs.answer: The industry has increased its use of automation over the past five years, helping to improve operational efficiency. However, it still requires a significant level of human labor input, which is unlikely to change in the foreseeable future.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly influenced profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Industry regulations related to fuel economy standards have led companies to partially refurbish their fleets with energy-efficient vehicles, accelerating depreciation costs and constraining profit growth.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profitability compare with that of your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: Industry profit has been constrained by increasing vehicle prices due to fuel economy standards imposed by regulation and the incorporation of internet of things technologies.

FAQs.question: How close are you located to large population centers? What are your strategies for accessing a pool of customers?
FAQs.answer: ATV rental and leasing companies need an expansive rental and service network to provide services to a wide range of consumers located near large population centers.

FAQs.question: What legal standards must you abide by? Have you had difficulty complying with regulations?
FAQs.answer: Enterprises operating in this industry must be capable of providing products that comply with legal standards. Products that fail to meet these criteria are barred from being rented in the United States.

FAQs.question: How are you able to keep capital investments low? What kind of credit are you able to secure for your business?
FAQs.answer: This industry requires large initial capital investment. Consequently, operators with access to inexpensive credit tend to operate more efficiently and with greater flexibility.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your total revenue comes from domestic travelers? What nearby attractions or destinations draw in travelers?
FAQs.answer: As traveling increases, more people would partake in discretionary activities, such as those provided by this industry.

FAQs.question: Do you track changes in consumer confidence?
FAQs.answer: An increase in consumer sentiment can lead to a subsequent increase in spending on discretionary items and services.
